page.title: 11 Newton Road Junior School
page.content: When the school was first opened in 1894 it soon grew in size to over 600 pupils (2 classes used the hall). Log and punishment books were kept, they can still be read and are still kept up-to-date. The school is a large brick building, decorated with beautiful Victorian, patterned tiles. In 1982 the bell tower was restored and the bell rung after many silent years, it is rung regularly to start school today. In 1982 the school was modernised. Ceilings(false) have been lowered to save heating costs. A secretary's room has been built from an old cloakroom. The old staff room is now a library, a staff room was made from an upstairs classroom. 2 other rooms now open onto a wet area. Their small playground has outside toilets. They have no field.
